Utilities

Class Image2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Image
      • Utilities.Image2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RadixSortable, java.io.Serializable

    public class Image2D
extends java.awt.Image
implements java.io.Serializable, RadixSortable
    A Class which holds a sprite, and can draw it.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Image2D

        public Image2D(java.lang.String s)
        Takes a string of the location in the project the images resides, and image name. By default, this will try to optimize the image to best fit with local graphics configurations. If you do not want this, use the contructor "Image2D(String s, boolean optimize)" with the second value as "false". Example: the Image called ball in folder Sprites: "Sprites/ball.png"
        Parameters:
        s - -the string of the image name and location.

      • Image2D

        public Image2D(java.lang.String s,
       boolean optimize)
        Takes a string of the location in the project the images resides, and image name. This gives you the option to have non-optimized images for your local graphics environment.
        Parameters:
        s - the string of the image name and location
        optimize - whether or not optimize the image for local environments.

      • Image2D

        public Image2D()
        a default constructor, using the super default constructor

      • Image2D

        public Image2D(java.awt.Image i)
        This is generally only for AdHoc image drawing. Do not rely upon. Doesn't cache images.
        Parameters:
        i - image to AdHoc draw
